scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. Monica and Bob exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You responded by asking if anyone has a better idea or a more efficient way to get this done, otherwise, to get back to work. The team resumes work, but the tension is palpable. Monica sighs loudly and says, 'I really don't see how we can manage this.' You noticed Bob shaking his head and muttering, 'This is just setting us up for failure.' You addressed the negativity directly and opened the floor for specific concerns. Bob raises his hand and says, 'I think we need more resources or more time to make this feasible.'
scenes.description: [Monica] nods in agreement and says, 'He's right, we can't do this alone.'

options.text: We might not get more resources, but we can ask for a deadline extension. Let's outline what we need and present it to management.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's concerns and proposed a practical solution, demonstrating high empathy and good social skills.

options.text: I understand the concerns, but we have to work with what we have. Let's focus on optimizing our current resources and see how far that gets us.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and make the best use of their resources, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: We can't expect miracles, but complaining won't help. If you have specific resource needs, let's list them and see what we can do.
options.analysis: You addressed the concerns directly and opened the floor for specific needs, showing moderate emotion perception and self-regulation.
